Description: Handle plate of Attic black-figured pottery column-krater; inside black with an added red band (0.7 cm) at the lip; on top of plate, swan to left; added red on wing-bow; edge of plate black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit: 'Manner of Lydos β; the bird is almost identical to that on Louvre CA 11253 (see no. 260).' The similarity is somewhat generic
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 78 no. 261 pl. 59)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0953)
